ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: New acting techniques and I improved my understanding of plays and how to Analyse them

Over the summer, I developed a new view of acting and the way I approach it. In Text Class, I learned how to analyze a play, break it into beats, and the major elements of the plot. In Voice, I worked on alignment, vocal projection, and locating different resonators in the body. In Movement, I got out of my comfort zone and felt what it was like not to be prohibited by socialization. Finally, in Acting, I learned to follow a path of stimuli, listen/respond to my partner, truthfully chase an objective, and use my given circumstances to inform my character choices.

- An understanding for the actor-audience relationship through clowning
- Different resonators in the body and how to utilize the natural voice
- Text analysis tools for different types of texts
- Enhanced understanding of 'living truthfully under given circumstances' within the acting circumstance, and additional rehearsal tools to help enrich the experience
Not only did I become a better actor, I became a better human.
I learned and incredible amount of confidence, ability to play, partner work, and overall improvement in acting.
I worked with skills regarding clowning, text analysis of plays, the voice as its own instrument and its application to text, and also safe, truthful acting.

I learned about who I am, who I want to be and how to get there. The course gave me insights into the life of an actor and what my life awaits if I choose to follow that path, but it also opened the possibility of a new career-path as a director, editor, cinematographer etc. I learned that each one is as important as the other to create the art of film and theater. In the skills department I would say I developed the knowledge to prepare my body and my mind for acting in a profesional way, they opened the doorway towards the technique of acting for me and I choose to step in and follow whatever comes next. I believe this course was very helpful for me and it was a taste of what my actual college life is gonna be like, that is exciting and also scary because it means there is no formula to acting, rather you take and you use whatever resonates with your craft. This course helped me grow in a way that I wouldnt have been able to do on my own, I overcame my fear of being judged while acting I front of people because that was a safe space to do so, thank you for that.
So much about acting that I didn't even know I didn't know. I now have tools that I can use and practice in my work going forward.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think there could be more acting classes and less of the other classes

A major strength of the course is the one-on-one time with TAs and instructors, especially in acting class. Due to the specific attention, I especially saw improvement during these times. Additionally, all of the instructors are incredibly enthusiastic and knowledgeable in their fields. My only comment would be to do more in Acting class. We were only able to do a one-page scene, a contemporary scene, and a monologue during the five weeks.

I feel that it could be even more intensive with more acting classes/variety
I enjoyed what I have learned, although I did feel like I was willing to contribute even more time to get as much out of the program as possible
The courses were amazing! My only complaint was the condition of the dorm bathrooms.

I loved it overall. I wish we had more acting classes or more similarities among the acting sections. I thought the multitude of classes was very helpful. 

I personally found some of the younger students at a maturity level in which they were not as dedicated to learning as some of the older college aged and post-grad students. I did find them to be a disruption in classes often, even the ones that I consider dear friends now. 

However, I truly loved the course and I do feel that I have grown as an actor and performer.

I believe the only weakness is that during the whole program we dont get to interact with other sections. I was in section C2 and I never had class with Section A (except for the masterclasses and warmups) but I believed that led me into believing that maybe that was the reason I did not get along with them as much as I did with the other section I was in. But I also believe that is a strength because by making the groups smaller the attention towards our craft is more specific and detailed.

I think a potential weakness of the program would be the fact that the two groups are so separated from each other and to my knowledge have quite a different experience. That being said (in my ignorance of how the groups were formed in the first place), I have heard that there was a general difference in terms of level of engagement amongst some students in the other section. The difference in age and experience is also a question that I have, because while I feel like that was not an issue in the slightest in my group, it could have a huge impact with another set of students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would, It was a great experience and I learned a lot of new skills

I would definitely recommend this course to another student, but they must be willing to fully immerse themselves in it. I got so much out of my time here because everyone was completely committed to learning and collaborating.

No, because I don't know anyone in my daily life who would wish to undertake such a learning process for theatre and acting. However, if anyone asks about the course, I would recommend it with no hesitation
I am so grateful for these past five weeks and have been recommending this Conservatory to all of my peers.
Absolutely. It is challenging, but extremely engaging and it pushes you to be a better actor.
Yes! The course is great in addressing a specific base that can be applied to any acting project.

Yes. If someone is interested in acting this course is for them, especially if they are not experts in the craft like me. The course allowed me to open up and discover what type of path I wanna follow and improved the knowledge I thought I had about acting.
Absolutely. If you have interest in acting, no matter your level, it is an incredible course that will help you to grow from wherever you are.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I will take much of this approach to acting and use it as I prepare for auditions, films, and plays. What I have learned has already improved my work, and I am excited to continue applying it in the future.

I am not sure who Jon Hackler is but I will be applying what I have learned in my social life, my daily practicing as an aspiring actor (I now warm up daily with the exercises from class), as well, in the plays and performance opportunities I will get to take part in in the near future.
I have two notebooks full of so much knowledge that I have gained that I am going to apply to my future work as an actor.
I intend to apply my learnings to my upcoming auditions and acting productions in this upcoming school year and even beyond that.

This course was the beginning of the rest of my life, I wouldnt say Im going to use everything I learned but Im sure that this will help me create the basis and the roots of my acting craft. In the imminent future this course is going to be of much help for college auditions and in the long-term future itll continue to expand my mind into knowing that the art of acting is a craft that requires dedication and effort as much as passion and technique. 
Breathe, Believe, Begin. -Will Cobbs
I want to be an actor, so the knowledge and skills helped me in exactly that.

extras.title: DRMA S001 01 - Yale Conservatory for Actors
